page.title: 04LOCAL GOVERNMENT IN HARWICH
page.content: THE SIXTEEN COUNCILLORS DECIDED SEVERAL WEEKS BEFORE MAYOR-MAKING WHO WAS TO BE THE NEXT MAYOR. AT THE CEREMONY ON MAY 23RD, COUNCILLOR MARSHALL MADE A SPEECH SAYING THAT MRS. ELLEBY WOULD MAKE A VERY GOOD MAYOR. MRS.ELLEBY THEN READ FROM A CARD ACCEPTING THE PROPOSAL. MRS. COOPER WAS ASKED BY MRS.ELLEBY TO BE THE MAYORESS AS MRS ELLEBY'S DAUGHTER LIVES IN NOTTINGHAM. THE DAUGHTER WAS PRESENT AT THE CEREMONY AND RECEIVED A BOUQUET FROM HER MOTHER. THE REVEREND BARRATT BECAME MRS.ELLEBY'S CHAPLAIN FOR THE YEAR. A CHURCH SERVICE WAS THEN HELD IN ST. NICHOLAS CHURCH, AND THE PARTY THEN RETURNED TO THE GUILDHALL FOR THE TRADITIONAL THROWING OF KITCHELS - BUNS - FROM THE BALCONY TO THE CHILDREN WAITING BELOW. FOR HYGIENIC REASONS THEY WERE WRAPPED UP THIS YEAR
